sins.question: Did I deny or doubt God's existence?
sins.details: Faith requires belief in God and rejects all forms of atheism or agnosticism.

sins.question: Did I refuse to believe God's revelation?
sins.details: Refusing God’s revelation is a serious offense against faith.

sins.question: Did I believe in horoscopes, fortune telling, good luck charms, tarot cards, Ouija boards, or reincarnation?
sins.details: Practices like divination demonstrate a lack of trust in God.

sins.question: Did I deny that I was a Catholic?
sins.details: Denial of faith is a serious offense.

sins.question: Did I abandon the Catholic Faith for any period of time?
sins.details: Apostasy or abandonment of faith is a grave offense.

sins.question: Did I despair of or presume on God's mercy?
sins.details: Despair and presumption are offenses against trust in God.

sins.question: Did I neglect prayer for a long time?
sins.details: Neglecting prayer weakens one’s relationship with God.

sins.question: Did I fail to pray daily?
sins.details: Daily prayer is essential to maintain spiritual health.

sins.question: Did I blaspheme God or take God's Name in vain, curse, or break an oath or vow?
sins.details: Blasphemy is a grave offense against the second commandment.

sins.question: Did I miss Mass on a Sunday or on a Holy Day of Obligation through my own fault?
sins.details: Failing to attend Mass without valid reason is a serious sin.

sins.question: Am I always reverent in the presence of the Most Blessed Sacrament?
sins.details: Reverence is due in the presence of the Eucharist.

sins.question: Was I voluntarily inattentive at Mass?
sins.details: Mass requires active participation and attention.

sins.question: Did I arrive at Mass late through my own fault?
sins.details: Punctuality shows respect for the Mass.

sins.question: Did I leave Mass early?
sins.details: Leaving Mass early without serious reason is disrespectful.

sins.question: Did I do unnecessary servile work on Sunday?
sins.details: Sunday is a day of rest and worship, not for servile labor.

sins.question: Did I disobey or disrespect my parents or legitimate superiors?
sins.details: Respect for authority is part of the Fourth Commandment.

sins.question: Did I neglect my duties to my husband, wife, children, or parents?
sins.details: Family members are called to honor their responsibilities to each other.

sins.question: Did I fail to actively take an interest in the religious education and formation of my children?
sins.details: Parents are obligated to educate their children in faith.

sins.question: Have I failed to educate myself concerning the teachings of the Church?
sins.details: Learning the teachings of the Church is a lifelong responsibility.

sins.question: Did I give a full day's work in return for a full day's pay?
sins.details: Just work for just pay is part of respecting labor rights.

sins.question: Did I give a fair wage to my employee(s)?
sins.details: Fair wages are required by justice and the dignity of work.

sins.question: Did I give scandal by what I said or did, especially to the young?
sins.details: Giving scandal leads others to sin and is a grave offense.

sins.question: Did I contribute to anyone's abandoning of the Catholic Faith?
sins.details: Leading others away from faith is a serious sin.

sins.question: Was I uncharitable in thought, word, or deed?
sins.details: Charity requires us to love our neighbor as ourselves.

category: Sins Against Life and the Body

sins.question: Did I physically injure or kill anyone?
sins.details: Harming others is against the Fifth Commandment.

sins.question: Have I had an abortion, or advised or supported an abortion?
sins.details: Abortion is a grave sin against the sanctity of life.

sins.question: Did I participate in or approve of euthanasia or doctor-assisted suicide?
sins.details: Taking life through euthanasia or assisted suicide is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Did I attempt suicide or physically harm myself?
sins.details: The Church teaches against self-harm and suicide.

sins.question: Did I willfully entertain impure thoughts and desires?
sins.details: Impure thoughts and desires are serious sins against chastity.

sins.question: Did I dress immodestly or provocatively?
sins.details: Modesty protects the virtue of chastity.

sins.question: Did I use impure or suggestive words?
sins.details: Speech should reflect chastity and respect.

sins.question: Did I deliberately look at impure television, internet content, plays, pictures, or movies?
sins.details: Viewing impure material violates chastity.

sins.question: Did I read or send impure material?
sins.details: Engaging in impure materials, including reading or sharing, is sinful.

sins.question: Did I perform impure acts, such as masturbation, adultery, fornication, or sodomy?
sins.details: Impure acts violate the call to chastity and the purpose of human sexuality.

sins.question: Did I steal, cheat, help or encourage others to steal or cheat, or keep stolen goods?
sins.details: Theft and deceit are offenses against justice and respect for others' property.

sins.question: Have I made restitution for stolen goods?
sins.details: Restitution is required to remedy the injustice of theft.

sins.question: Did I fail to fulfill my contracts or pay my bills?
sins.details: Honoring agreements is part of social justice.

sins.question: Did I give or accept bribes?
sins.details: Bribery undermines justice and fairness.

sins.question: Did I tell lies to deceive or harm others, commit slander, or commit calumny?
sins.details: Lying, slander, and calumny are sins against truth and justice.

sins.question: Did I fail to keep secrets I should have kept?
sins.details: Keeping appropriate confidences respects privacy and trust.

sins.question: Did I forgive those who have hurt me or my loved ones?
sins.details: Forgiveness is central to the Christian life and necessary for reconciliation.

sins.question: Did I vote according to a properly informed conscience, consistent with Church teachings?
sins.details: Christians have a duty to vote in line with values of justice and respect for life.
